turns.content: Are there any special tax considerations that should be taken into account when child support payments are made in excess of the court-ordered amount?

As an AI language model, I don't have the expertise to provide legal or financial advice; however, generally speaking, if child support payments are made in excess of the court-ordered amount, the excess payments are not tax-deductible for the person making the payments, and they are not taxable income for the person receiving the payments. However, it's important to consult with a tax professional or attorney for specific information and advice based on individual circumstances.
